fields.System.Title: Send emails when people are tagged in Ops Dash Alerts
fields.System.Description:
Operations Dashboard sends emails to people with whom an alert is shared through the highlighted functionality below, and it is called "Sharing an alert".



We want to use the same email notification functionality being used with the "Sharing alert" for when people are tagged in the following places:
  1. Action Plans -- Currently, the action plans do not support tagging as requested as part of #53688, so we need to follow up on that to be able to finish this up. 
  2. Action Plan Tasks
  3. Activities
An example of tagging can be seen below:



If you need more information, please reach out to @Harish Majeti and @James Bloom. @Harish Majeti is the original developer of the email notifications with alert sharing.
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
Sending a notification email to the tagged people:
  1. Action Plans
  2. Action Plan Tasks
  3. Activities

fields.System.Title: Design a solution that generates BDP connection strings dynamically in the DF deployment scripts
Show a simple bar chart for comparison between old incident number and the new one in Crime Trend Alerts
fields.System.Description:
We need a simple bar chart in the content area of Crime Trend alerts which shows two bars. The first bar shows the old incident number, and the other bar shows the new incident number. The difference between these incidents numbers triggered the alert, so these bars represent these numbers.

Just to be on the same page about the bar chart, this is how a sample bar chart looks like:

fields.System.Title: Sort the new column in a way that the oldest alerts are at the top
fields.System.Description:
We need the following column to be sorted in a way that the oldest alerts are at the top and the newest ones are at the bottom:



Please check the following screenshot for the current implementation:



Important Note:

The sort dropdown does not show up when there is no item in Active/Snoozed/etc. tab even if New column has items in it. This is a bug, but once you complete this story, this bug becomes corrected automatically since it won't matter for the new column anymore.
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. New column is sorted by created time asc
  2. Sort dropdown does not change the sort of the new column anymore.

fields.System.Title: Convert Law schema to our incident schema
fields.System.Description:
We need to convert the law/case schema to our incident schema in LexisNexis. 

The law schema with person example:
https://msi-cie.visualstudio.com/OneRMS/_git/OneRMS-JSON-Schemas?path=%2Fschemas%2Fv1.0%2FLaw%2Fsamples%2Flaw.sample-with-persons.json

Our schema can be seen here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/17iceHEt2fvHzGX7P_RcOGAAFbOjyeKhFDnX-bPe6ZOg/edit

fields.System.Description: Case documents use code tables references for some of their fields and these fields must be retrieved from LSM service to resolve them to actual values that can be used in the final incident document that is going to be mapped to LexisNexis XML document.

fields.System.Title: Add Ingress definition to the deploy file of LexisNexisIncidentConnector
fields.System.Description:
Since LexisNexisIncidentConnector project is becoming a web project, it needs a URL to be accessed. Hence, it needs an Ingress definition in its `deploy.yml` file that follows the same master/minion Ingress approach in the Alerts Service project: https://dev.azure.com/msi-cie/Predictive/_git/AlertsService?path=%2FDeployment%2Fdeploy.yml&version=GBmaster&line=90&lineEnd=147&lineStartColumn=1&lineEndColumn=41&lineStyle=plain

LexisNexisIncidentConnector might not have the Swagger endpoints available at the time of writing this description but talk to @James Bloom about the plans since he is converting LexisNexisIncidentConnector from being a simple background service to a web service. If the swagger endpoint is not available, still add the Ingress JWT validation exceptions for the potential Swagger URLs so that we don't have to come back to this project and add these exceptions when the actual endpoints for Swagger become available.

The URL of this service will be: 
https://lexisnexis.dev.commandcentral.com/connector/api/v1
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
1. Accessible through https://lexisnexis.envname.commandcentral.com/connector/api/v1
  2. All of the endpoints except for Swagger endpoints REQUIRE JWT validation, hence an access token through the ingress definition
  3. Swagger endpoints don't require JWT but they require the visitors to be coming from Motorola IP addresses
  4. Product URL (lexisnexis.envname.commandcentral.com/connector/ingest/v1) comes from the Variable Libraries in the release pipeline stages

fields.System.Title: Display text values of the Shift field of Predictive records instead of the ID value
fields.Microsoft.VSTS.Common.AcceptanceCriteria:
Currently, our prediction cards are showing numbers 1, 2, 3, etc. for the shift field as shown below:



However, it needs to be replaced with the following text values:


The shift field comes from Predictive endpoint, which is used to generate prediction alerts daily. @Brandon Christensen is the person who maintains this endpoint, and coordination is necessary with him. He has the code ready that returns these textual shift values rather than the numbers from the prediction endpoints. Once he merges his code into the Predictive project's production branch, our code should in Operations Dashboard must be ready to use this field instead of as Shift ID won't be given us anymore. 

Once our code is changed to use Shift Textual Value rather than ID, the existing data won't be compatible with the code. Hence, all of our test data will have to be dropped too. Coordinate with @Harish Majeti and @Tarik Guney for more information.
